column63: I Trust The "Leadership" To An Extent. There Is Though Over The Past Few Years An Underlying Paranoia Which Gets Stronger As Time Goes On. The Good Old Fashioned Straight Talking  Hard Working Approach Isnt Always The Forward As We Seem To Have Gone Down The "Big Hotel" Syndrome Of Watching Ones Back Constantly  And Having To Watch Ones Words For Fear Of Them Returning To Haunt. Sopwell Used To Be Run Like A Small Hotel That Had Just Got Bigger With A Truly Honest "We're In This Together" Team Spirit  That Is Still Spoken Of  But I Don't Think Many Truly Believe This Today.  My Manager Does Their Level Best To Stick To Their Word  But Sometimes This Is Made All The Harder By The Strains Enforced By The Senior Management At Times.
column72: The Performance Standards Could Be A Lot Better. To Manage A Team A Manager Must Have Be Allowed The Time To Do So. I Have A Theory That A Good Kitchen Is Like An Orchestra  All The Talent And Experience Is Harnessed And Guided Through By A Conductor. Too Many Are Like Jazz Bands Who Just Turn Up And Play Their Own Tunes.  I Would Say That A Percentage Of My Colleagues Are Committed To Providing High Quality Service  However  It Is Easy To Be Ground Down In Such A Tough Arena. Again  Good Managers Need Time To Talk With Their Team  To Pick Them Up And Dust Them Down After A Tough Day  But Time Is Rarely On Our Side.  I Believe In Some Areas We Shine Beyond Our Competitors  In Others We Pale In Comparison. A Good Market Research Is To Actually See What Is Being Done  Experience What Others Have To Offer. In Such A Large Busy Hotel It Is Hard To Ensure That Every Staff Member Is Delivering Unless You Have The Correct Sop's  Targets/Aims/Goals And Infrastructure In The Team.
